page.title: 06CHANGING TIMES.
page.content: On the Birkacre site there have been many industries going back to the Middle Ages. There was a fulling mill there in the (14 which was powered by a water wheel. The water-fall which provided the water was constructed from locally quarried mill-stone. There was a corn mill in the area which was powered by a donkey walk wheel. The district was rich in minerals, iron ore being mined locally and smelted at a forge on Sunny Brow. The largest industry was coal mining which at one time employed approximately 1,000 men at 28 pits. A railway line ran from the shafts to a weigh-bridge on Pall Mall. The coal was then loaded on to carts and distributed. A spinning mill and a bleach and a printing mill have also been sited here. Museums and a Leisure Park are to be set up to preserve the area's industrial history and beauty.
